intro: Dichromena tenera, commonly known as the slender dichromena, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Dichromena tenera is considered a rare and endangered species.
